trans-unit.source: 1) Functions that use the underlying operating system facilities to perform name resolution, and that do not necessarily perform any network communication. This category contains only one function: dns.lookup(). Developers looking to perform name resolution in the same way that other applications on the same operating system behave should use dns.lookup().
trans-unit.target: 1) Funciones que utilizan las instalaciones del sistema operativo subyacente para realizar la resolución de nombres y que no necesariamente realizan ninguna comunicación de red. Esta categoría contiene solo una función: dns.lookup() . Los desarrolladores que buscan realizar la resolución de nombres de la misma manera que se comportan otras aplicaciones en el mismo sistema operativo deben usar dns.lookup() .

trans-unit.source: 2) Functions that connect to an actual DNS server to perform name resolution, and that always use the network to perform DNS queries. This category contains all functions in the dns module exceptdns.lookup(). These functions do not use the same set of configuration files used by dns.lookup() (e.g. /etc/hosts). These functions should be used by developers who do not want to use the underlying operating system's facilities for name resolution, and instead want to always perform DNS queries.
trans-unit.target: 2) Funciones que se conectan a un servidor DNS real para realizar la resolución de nombres, y que siempre usan la red para realizar consultas DNS. Esta categoría contiene todas las funciones del módulo dns excepto dns.lookup() . Estas funciones no utilizan el mismo conjunto de archivos de configuración que utiliza dns.lookup() (por ejemplo, /etc/hosts ). Estas funciones deben ser utilizadas por desarrolladores que no quieran utilizar las funciones del sistema operativo subyacente para la resolución de nombres y, en su lugar, quieran realizar siempre consultas DNS.

Buffer.alloc(size[, fill[, encoding]]) returns a new initialized Buffer of the specified size. This method is slower than Buffer.allocUnsafe(size) but guarantees that newly created Buffer instances never contain old data that is potentially sensitive. A TypeError will be thrown if size is not a number.
trans-unit.target: Buffer.alloc(size[, fill[, encoding]]) devuelve un nuevo Buffer inicializadodel tamaño especificado. Este método es más lento que Buffer.allocUnsafe(size) pero garantiza que lasinstancias de Buffer recién creadasnunca contengan datos antiguos que sean potencialmente sensibles. Selanzaráun TypeError si el size no es un número.

trans-unit.source: Buffer.allocUnsafe(size) and Buffer.allocUnsafeSlow(size) each return a new uninitialized Buffer of the specified size. Because the Buffer is uninitialized, the allocated segment of memory might contain old data that is potentially sensitive.
trans-unit.target: Buffer.allocUnsafe(size) y Buffer.allocUnsafeSlow(size) devuelven cada uno un nuevo Buffer no inicializadodel size especificado. Debido a que el Buffer no está inicializado, el segmento de memoria asignado puede contener datos antiguos que son potencialmente confidenciales.

trans-unit.source: Buffer.from(array) returns a new Buffer that contains a copy of the provided octets.
trans-unit.target: Buffer.from(array) devuelve un nuevo Buffer que contiene una copia de los octetos proporcionados.

trans-unit.source: Buffer.from(buffer) returns a new Buffer that contains a copy of the contents of the given Buffer.
trans-unit.target: Buffer.from(buffer) devuelve un nuevo Buffer que contiene una copia del contenido del Buffer dado.

trans-unit.source: Buffer.from(string[, encoding]) returns a new Buffer that contains a copy of the provided string.
trans-unit.target: Buffer.from(string[, encoding]) devuelve un nuevo Buffer que contiene una copia de la cadena proporcionada.

child_process.exec(): spawns a shell and runs a command within that shell, passing the stdout and stderr to a callback function when complete.

trans-unit.target: child_process.execFile() : similar a child_process.exec() excepto que genera el comando directamente sin primero generar un shell por defecto.

trans-unit.target: child_process.fork() : genera un nuevo proceso Node.js e invoca un módulo específico con un canal de comunicación IPC establecido que permite enviar mensajes entre padre e hijo.

trans-unit.source: dnsPromises.lookup() does not necessarily have anything to do with the DNS protocol. The implementation uses an operating system facility that can associate names with addresses, and vice versa. This implementation can have subtle but important consequences on the behavior of any Node.js program. Please take some time to consult the Implementation considerations section before using dnsPromises.lookup().
trans-unit.target: dnsPromises.lookup() no necesariamente tiene nada que ver con el protocolo DNS. La implementación utiliza una función del sistema operativo que puede asociar nombres con direcciones y viceversa. Esta implementación puede tener consecuencias sutiles pero importantes en el comportamiento de cualquier programa Node.js. Tómese un tiempo para consultar la sección Consideraciones de implementación antes de usar dnsPromises.lookup() .

trans-unit.source: Conditional Exports can also be used within "exports" to define different package entry points per environment, including whether the package is referenced via require or via import.

Conditional exports can be used within "exports" to define different package entry points per environment, including whether the package is referenced via require or via import. For more information about supporting both CommonJS and ES Modules in a single package please consult the dual CommonJS/ES module packages section.
"exports" - Package exports and conditional exports. When present, limits which submodules can be loaded from within the package.
"imports" - Package imports, for use by modules within the package itself.
"main" - The default module when loading the package, if exports is not specified, and in versions of Node.js prior to the introduction of exports.
"name" - Relevant when using named imports within a package. Also used by package managers as the name of the package.
"type" - The package type determining whether to load .js files as CommonJS or ES modules.

<string> The default value of the maxVersion option of tls.createSecureContext(). It can be assigned any of the supported TLS protocol versions, 'TLSv1.3', 'TLSv1.2', 'TLSv1.1', or 'TLSv1'. Default:'TLSv1.3', unless changed using CLI options. Using --tls-max-v1.2 sets the default to 'TLSv1.2'. Using --tls-max-v1.3 sets the default to 'TLSv1.3'. If multiple of the options are provided, the highest maximum is used.

<string> The default value of the maxVersion option of tls.createSecureContext(). It can be assigned any of the supported TLS protocol versions, TLSv1.3, TLSv1.2', 'TLSv1.1', or 'TLSv1'. Default:'TLSv1.3', unless changed using CLI options. Using --tls-max-v1.2 sets the default to 'TLSv1.2'. Using --tls-max-v1.3 sets the default to 'TLSv1.3'. If multiple of the options are provided, the highest maximum is used.
trans-unit.target: <string> El valor por defecto de la maxVersion opción de tls.createSecureContext() . Se le puede asignar cualquiera de las versiones de protocolo TLS admitidas, TLSv1.3 , TLSv1.2' , 'TLSv1.1' o 'TLSv1' . Predeterminado: 'TLSv1.3' , a menos que se cambie mediante las opciones de CLI. El uso de --tls-max-v1.2 establece el valor predeterminado en 'TLSv1.2 '. El uso de --tls-max-v1.3 establece el valor predeterminado en 'TLSv1.3' . Si se proporcionan varias de las opciones, se utiliza el máximo más alto.

trans-unit.source: <string> The default value of the minVersion option of tls.createSecureContext(). It can be assigned any of the supported TLS protocol versions, 'TLSv1.3', 'TLSv1.2', 'TLSv1.1', or 'TLSv1'. Default:'TLSv1.2', unless changed using CLI options. Using --tls-min-v1.0 sets the default to 'TLSv1'. Using --tls-min-v1.1 sets the default to 'TLSv1.1'. Using --tls-min-v1.3 sets the default to 'TLSv1.3'. If multiple of the options are provided, the lowest minimum is used.

Using --tls-min-v1.3 sets the default to 'TLSv1.3'. If multiple of the options are provided, the lowest minimum is used.

Si se proporcionan varias de las opciones,se utiliza el mínimo más bajo.

CMake.js is an alternative build system based on CMake.

libuv: The C library that implements the Node.js event loop, its worker threads and all of the asynchronous behaviors of the platform. It also serves as a cross-platform abstraction library, giving easy, POSIX-like access across all major operating systems to many common system tasks, such as interacting with the filesystem, sockets, timers, and system events. libuv also provides a pthreads-like threading abstraction that may be used to power more sophisticated asynchronous Addons that need to move beyond the standard event loop. Addon authors are encouraged to think about how to avoid blocking the event loop with I/O or other time-intensive tasks by off-loading work via libuv to non-blocking system operations, worker threads or a custom use of libuv's threads.
trans-unit.target: libuv : la biblioteca C que implementa el bucle de eventos Node.js, sus subprocesos de trabajo y todos los comportamientos asincrónicos de la plataforma. También sirve como una biblioteca de abstracción multiplataforma, que brinda acceso fácil, similar a POSIX, en todos los principales sistemas operativos a muchas tareas comunes del sistema, como interactuar con el sistema de archivos, sockets, temporizadores y eventos del sistema. libuv también proporciona una abstracción de subprocesos similar a pthreads que puede usarse para impulsar complementos asíncronos más sofisticados que necesitan ir más allá del bucle de eventos estándar. Se anima a los autores de complementos a pensar en cómo evitar bloquear el bucle de eventos con E / S u otras tareas que requieren mucho tiempo descargando el trabajo a través de libuv a operaciones del sistema sin bloqueo, subprocesos de trabajo o un uso personalizado de los subprocesos de libuv.

trans-unit.source: libuv: The C library that implements the Node.js event loop, its worker threads and all of the asynchronous behaviors of the platform. It also serves as a cross-platform abstraction library, giving easy, POSIX-like access across all major operating systems to many common system tasks, such as interacting with the filesystem, sockets, timers, and system events. libuv also provides a pthreads-like threading abstraction that may be used to power more sophisticated asynchronous addons that need to move beyond the standard event loop. Addon authors are encouraged to think about how to avoid blocking the event loop with I/O or other time-intensive tasks by off-loading work via libuv to non-blocking system operations, worker threads or a custom use of libuv's threads.

libuv: The C library that implements the Node.js event loop, its worker threads and all of the asynchronous behaviors of the platform. It also serves as a cross-platform abstraction library, giving easy, POSIX-like access across all major operating systems to many common system tasks, such as interacting with the filesystem, sockets, timers, and system events. libuv also provides a threading abstraction similar to POSIX threads for more sophisticated asynchronous addons that need to move beyond the standard event loop. Addon authors should avoid blocking the event loop with I/O or other time-intensive tasks by offloading work via libuv to non-blocking system operations, worker threads, or a custom use of libuv threads.

node-pre-gyp is a tool based on node-gyp that adds the ability to upload binaries to a server of the developer's choice. node-pre-gyp has particularly good support for uploading binaries to Amazon S3.
node-gyp is a build system based on Google's GYP tool and comes bundled with npm. GYP, and therefore node-gyp, requires that Python be installed.

prebuild is a tool that supports builds using either node-gyp or CMake.js. Unlike node-pre-gyp which supports a variety of servers, prebuild uploads binaries only to GitHub releases. prebuild is a good choice for GitHub projects using CMake.js.

prebuildify is a tool based on node-gyp. The advantage of prebuildify is that the built binaries are bundled with the native module when it's uploaded to npm. The binaries are downloaded from npm and are immediately available to the module user when the native module is installed.
btest402: Generally used to check whether Node.js with Intl support is built correctly.
trans-unit.target: btest402 : generalmente se usa para verificar si Node.js con soporte Intl está construido correctamente.

Section 8.7 of the ECMAScript Language Specification defines the concept of an "Agent" as a self-contained environment in which JavaScript code runs. Multiple such Agents may be started and terminated either concurrently or in sequence by the process.
trans-unit.target: La Sección 8.7 de la Especificación del lenguaje ECMAScript define el concepto de "Agente" como un entorno autónomo en el que se ejecuta el código JavaScript. Múltiples Agentes pueden iniciarse y terminarse simultáneamente o en secuencia por el proceso.

trans-unit.source: Punycode is a character encoding scheme defined by RFC 3492 that is primarily intended for use in Internationalized Domain Names. Because host names in URLs are limited to ASCII characters only, Domain Names that contain non-ASCII characters must be converted into ASCII using the Punycode scheme. For instance, the Japanese character that translates into the English word, 'example' is ''. The Internationalized Domain Name, '.com' (equivalent to 'example.com') is represented by Punycode as the ASCII string 'xn--fsq.com'.
trans-unit.target: Punycode es un esquema de codificación de caracteres definido por RFC 3492 que está diseñado principalmente para su uso en nombres de dominio internacionalizados. Debido a que los nombres de host en las URL están limitados a caracteres ASCII únicamente, los nombres de dominio que contienen caracteres no ASCII deben convertirse a ASCII mediante el esquema Punycode. Por ejemplo, el carácter japonés que se traduce a la palabra inglesa 'example' es '' . El nombre de dominio internacionalizado, '.com' (equivalente a 'example.com' ) está representado por Punycode como la cadena ASCII 'xn--fsq.com' .

trans-unit.source: RFC 8441 defines an "Extended CONNECT Protocol" extension to HTTP/2 that may be used to bootstrap the use of an Http2Stream using the CONNECT method as a tunnel for other communication protocols (such as WebSockets).
trans-unit.target: RFC 8441 define una extensión de "Protocolo CONNECT extendido" para HTTP / 2 que puede usarse para iniciar el uso de un Http2Stream usando el método CONNECT como un túnel para otros protocolos de comunicación (como WebSockets).

trans-unit.source: Dynamic import() is supported in both CommonJS and ES modules. In CommonJS modules it can be used to load ES modules.
Dynamic import() is supported in both CommonJS and ES modules. It can be used to include ES module files from CommonJS code.

Core modules provide named exports of their public API. A default export is also provided which is the value of the CommonJS exports. The default export can be used for, among other things, modifying the named exports. Named exports of builtin modules are updated only by calling module.syncBuiltinESMExports().

trans-unit.source: process.env is a copy of the parent thread's environment variables, unless otherwise specified. Changes to one copy are not visible in other threads, and are not visible to native add-ons (unless worker.SHARE_ENV is passed as the env option to the Worker constructor).

process.env is a copy of the parent thread's environment variables, unless otherwise specified. Changes to one copy will not be visible in other threads, and will not be visible to native add-ons (unless worker.SHARE_ENV has been passed as the env option to the Worker constructor).
trans-unit.target: process.env es una copia de las variables de entorno del hilo principal, a menos que se especifique lo contrario. Los cambios en una copia no serán visibles en otros hilos y no serán visibles para los complementos nativos (a menos quese haya pasado worker.SHARE_ENV como laopción env alconstructor Worker ).

trans-unit.source: <Stream> object - Share a readable or writable stream that refers to a tty, file, socket, or a pipe with the child process. The stream's underlying file descriptor is duplicated in the child process to the fd that corresponds to the index in the stdio array. The stream must have an underlying descriptor (file streams do not until the 'open' event has occurred).
trans-unit.target: Objeto <Stream> : comparte un flujo legible o de escritura que hace referencia a un tty, archivo, socket o tubería con el proceso hijo. El descriptor de archivo subyacente de la secuencia se duplica en el proceso hijo al fd que corresponde al índice en la matriz stdio . La secuencia debe tener un descriptor subyacente (las secuencias de archivos no lo tienen hasta que se haya producido el evento 'open' ).

trans-unit.source: "cascade" for integrity checks will be ignored if "integrity" is explicitly set.
"default" - the generic fallback that always matches. Can be a CommonJS or ES module file. This condition should always come last.
"exit" - will exit the process immediately. No cleanup code will be allowed to run.
trans-unit.target: "exit" - saldrá del proceso inmediatamente. No se permitirá que se ejecute ningún código de limpieza.

trans-unit.source: "exit": will exit the process immediately. No cleanup code will be allowed to run.
"exports" is only honored when loading a package "name" as defined above. Any "exports" values within nested directories and packages must be declared by the package.json responsible for the "name".
trans-unit.target: "exports" solo se respeta cuando se carga un paquete "nombre" como se define anteriormente. Cualquier valor de "exports" dentro de directorios y paquetes anidados debe ser declarado por el package.json responsable del "nombre".

trans-unit.source: "import" - matches when the package is loaded via import or import(), or via any top-level import or resolve operation by the ECMAScript module loader. Applies regardless of the module format of the target file. Always mutually exclusive with "require".
"log" - will log the error at the site of the failure.
trans-unit.target: "log" : registrará el error en el lugar del error.

trans-unit.source: "log": will log the error at the site of the failure.
"node" - matches for any Node.js environment. Can be a CommonJS or ES module file. This condition should always come after "import" or "require".

"require" - matches when the package is loaded via require(). The referenced file should be loadable with require() although the condition matches regardless of the module format of the target file. Expected formats include CommonJS, JSON, and native addons but not ES modules as require() doesn't support them. Always mutually exclusive with "import".
"throw" (default) - will throw a JS error at the site of the failure.
trans-unit.target: "throw" (predeterminado): arrojará un error JS en el sitio del error.

trans-unit.source: "throw": will throw a JS error at the site of the failure. This is the default.

>128Signal Exits - If Node.js receives a fatal signal such as SIGKILL or SIGHUP, then its exit code will be 128 plus the value of the signal code. This is a standard POSIX practice, since exit codes are defined to be 7-bit integers, and signal exits set the high-order bit, and then contain the value of the signal code. For example, signal SIGABRT has value 6, so the expected exit code will be 128 + 6, or 134.
trans-unit.target: >128 salidas de señal : si Node.js recibe una señal fatal como SIGKILL o SIGHUP , entonces su código de salida será 128 más el valor del código de señal. Esta es una práctica estándar de POSIX, ya que los códigos de salida se definen como enteros de 7 bits y las salidas de señal establecen el bit de orden superior y luego contienen el valor del código de señal. Por ejemplo, la señal SIGABRT tiene valor 6 , por lo que el código de salida esperado será 128 + 6 o 134 .

trans-unit.source: >128Signal Exits: If Node.js receives a fatal signal such as SIGKILL or SIGHUP, then its exit code will be 128 plus the value of the signal code. This is a standard POSIX practice, since exit codes are defined to be 7-bit integers, and signal exits set the high-order bit, and then contain the value of the signal code. For example, signal SIGABRT has value 6, so the expected exit code will be 128 + 6, or 134.

trans-unit.source: 'SIGBREAK' is delivered on Windows when
'SIGBREAK' is delivered on Windows when <Ctrl>+<Break> is pressed, on non-Windows platforms it can be listened on, but there is no way to send or generate it.
trans-unit.target: 'SIGBREAK' se entrega en Windows cuando se <Ctrl>+<Break> , en plataformas que no son de Windows se puede escuchar, pero no hay forma de enviarlo o generarlo.

trans-unit.source: 'SIGBUS', 'SIGFPE', 'SIGSEGV' and 'SIGILL', when not raised artificially using kill(2), inherently leave the process in a state from which it is not safe to attempt to call JS listeners. Doing so might lead to the process hanging in an endless loop, since listeners attached using process.on() are called asynchronously and therefore unable to correct the underlying problem.
trans-unit.target: 'SIGBUS' , 'SIGFPE' , 'SIGSEGV' y 'SIGILL' , cuando no se generan artificialmente con kill(2) , dejan inherentemente el proceso en un estado desde el cual no es seguro intentar llamar a los oyentes JS. Si lo hace, podría provocar que el proceso se cuelgue en un bucle sin fin, ya que los oyentes conectados mediante process.on() se llaman de forma asincrónica y, por lo tanto, no pueden corregir el problema subyacente.

trans-unit.source: 'SIGBUS', 'SIGFPE', 'SIGSEGV' and 'SIGILL', when not raised artificially using kill(2), inherently leave the process in a state from which it is not safe to call JS listeners. Doing so might cause the process to stop responding.

'SIGHUP' is generated on Windows when the console window is closed, and on other platforms under various similar conditions. See signal(7). It can have a listener installed, however Node.js will be unconditionally terminated by Windows about 10 seconds later. On non-Windows platforms, the default behavior of SIGHUP is to terminate Node.js, but once a listener has been installed its default behavior will be removed.
trans-unit.target: 'SIGHUP' se genera en Windows cuando la ventana de la consola está cerrada, y en otras plataformas bajo varias condiciones similares. Ver signal(7) . Puede tener un oyente instalado; sin embargo, Windows terminará incondicionalmente Node.js unos 10 segundos después. En plataformas que no son de Windows, el comportamiento predeterminado de SIGHUP es finalizar Node.js, pero una vez que se ha instalado un oyente, se eliminará su comportamiento predeterminado.

trans-unit.source: 'SIGINT' from the terminal is supported on all platforms, and can usually be generated with
'SIGINT' from the terminal is supported on all platforms, and can usually be generated with <Ctrl>+C (though this may be configurable). It is not generated when terminal raw mode is enabled.
trans-unit.target: 'SIGINT' desde el terminal es compatible con todas las plataformas y, por lo general, se puede generar con <Ctrl>+C (aunque esto puede ser configurable). No se genera cuando el modo terminal sin procesar está habilitado.

trans-unit.source: 'SIGKILL' cannot have a listener installed, it will unconditionally terminate Node.js on all platforms.
trans-unit.target: 'SIGKILL' no puede tener un escucha instalado, terminará incondicionalmente Node.js en todas las plataformas.

trans-unit.source: 'SIGPIPE' is ignored by default. It can have a listener installed.
trans-unit.target: 'SIGPIPE' se ignora de forma predeterminada. Puede tener un oyente instalado.

trans-unit.source: 'SIGSTOP' cannot have a listener installed.
trans-unit.target: 'SIGSTOP' no puede tener un escucha instalado.

trans-unit.source: 'SIGTERM' and 'SIGINT' have default handlers on non-Windows platforms that reset the terminal mode before exiting with code 128 + signal number. If one of these signals has a listener installed, its default behavior will be removed (Node.js will no longer exit).
trans-unit.target: 'SIGTERM' y 'SIGINT' tienen controladores predeterminados en plataformas que no son de Windows que restablecen el modo de terminal antes de salir con el código 128 + signal number . Si una de estas señales tiene un oyente instalado, se eliminará su comportamiento predeterminado (Node.js ya no se cerrará).

trans-unit.source: 'SIGTERM' is not supported on Windows, it can be listened on.
trans-unit.target: 'SIGTERM' no es compatible con Windows, se puede escuchar.

trans-unit.source: 'SIGUSR1' is reserved by Node.js to start the debugger. It's possible to install a listener but doing so might interfere with the debugger.
trans-unit.target: 'SIGUSR1' Node.js reserva 'SIGUSR1' para iniciar el depurador . Es posible instalar un oyente, pero hacerlo podría interferir con el depurador.

trans-unit.source: 'SIGWINCH' is delivered when the console has been resized. On Windows, this will only happen on write to the console when the cursor is being moved, or when a readable tty is used in raw mode.
trans-unit.target: 'SIGWINCH' se entrega cuando la consola ha cambiado de tamaño. En Windows, esto solo sucederá al escribir en la consola cuando se mueve el cursor, o cuando se usa un tty legible en modo raw.

trans-unit.source: 'ascii': For 7-bit ASCII data only. When encoding a string into a Buffer, this is equivalent to using 'latin1'. When decoding a Buffer into a string, using this encoding will additionally unset the highest bit of each byte before decoding as 'latin1'. Generally, there should be no reason to use this encoding, as 'utf8' (or, if the data is known to always be ASCII-only, 'latin1') will be a better choice when encoding or decoding ASCII-only text. It is only provided for legacy compatibility.

trans-unit.source: 'errored': module.link() has been called, but at least one of its dependencies failed to link, either because the callback returned a Promise that is rejected, or because the Module the callback returned is invalid.
trans-unit.target: 'errored' : se ha llamado a module.link() , pero al menos una de sus dependencias no se pudo vincular, ya sea porque la devolución de llamada devolvió una Promise que se rechazó o porque el Module devolvió la devolución de llamada no es válido.

trans-unit.source: 'errored': The module has been evaluated, but an exception was thrown.
trans-unit.target: 'errored' : el módulo ha sido evaluado, pero se lanzó una excepción.

trans-unit.source: 'evaluated': The module has been successfully evaluated.
trans-unit.target: 'evaluated' : el módulo se ha evaluado correctamente.

trans-unit.source: 'evaluating': The module is being evaluated through a module.evaluate() on itself or a parent module.
trans-unit.target: 'evaluating' : El módulo se está evaluando a través de un module.evaluate() en sí mismo o en un módulo principal.

trans-unit.source: 'function' (Node.js only)
'gc' (Node.js only)
'hex' - Encode each byte as two hexadecimal characters.
trans-unit.target: 'hex' : codifica cada byte como dos caracteres hexadecimales.

trans-unit.source: 'hex': Encode each byte as two hexadecimal characters. Data truncation may occur when decoding strings that do exclusively contain valid hexadecimal characters. See below for an example.
'http' (Node.js only)
'http2' (Node.js only)
'ieee-p1363': Signature format r || s as proposed in IEEE-P1363.

'ignore' - Instructs Node.js to ignore the fd in the child. While Node.js will always open fds 0 - 2 for the processes it spawns, setting the fd to 'ignore' will cause Node.js to open /dev/null and attach it to the child's fd.
trans-unit.target: 'ignore' : indica a Node.js que ignore el fd en el niño. Si bien Node.js siempre abrirá fds 0 - 2 para los procesos que genera, configurar el fd en 'ignore' hará que Node.js abra /dev/null y lo adjunte al fd del niño.

trans-unit.source: 'ignore' - equivalent to ['ignore', 'ignore', 'ignore']
trans-unit.target: 'ignore' - equivalente a ['ignore', 'ignore', 'ignore']

trans-unit.source: 'ignore': Instructs Node.js to ignore the fd in the child. While Node.js will always open fds 0, 1, and 2 for the processes it spawns, setting the fd to 'ignore' will cause Node.js to open /dev/null and attach it to the child's fd.
'ignore': equivalent to ['ignore', 'ignore', 'ignore']

'inherit' - Pass through the corresponding stdio stream to/from the parent process. In the first three positions, this is equivalent to process.stdin, process.stdout, and process.stderr, respectively. In any other position, equivalent to 'ignore'.
trans-unit.target: 'inherit' : pase a través del flujo stdio correspondiente hacia / desde el proceso principal. En las tres primeras posiciones, esto es equivalente a process.stdin , process.stdout y process.stderr , respectivamente. En cualquier otra posición, equivalente a 'ignore' .

trans-unit.source: 'inherit' - equivalent to ['inherit', 'inherit', 'inherit'] or [0, 1, 2]
trans-unit.target: 'inherit' - equivalente a ['inherit', 'inherit', 'inherit'] o [0, 1, 2]

trans-unit.source: 'inherit': Pass through the corresponding stdio stream to/from the parent process. In the first three positions, this is equivalent to process.stdin, process.stdout, and process.stderr, respectively. In any other position, equivalent to 'ignore'.
'inherit': equivalent to ['inherit', 'inherit', 'inherit'] or [0, 1, 2]
'instantiated': The module has been instantiated successfully, but module.evaluate() has not yet been called.
trans-unit.target: 'instantiated' : el módulo se ha instanciado correctamente, pero aún no se ha llamado a module.evaluate() .

trans-unit.source: 'instantiating': The module is currently being instantiated through a module.instantiate() call on itself or a parent module.
trans-unit.target: 'instantiating' : el módulo se está instanciando actualmente a través de una llamada module.instantiate() en sí mismo o en un módulo principal.

trans-unit.source: 'ipc' - Create an IPC channel for passing messages/file descriptors between parent and child. A ChildProcess may have at most one IPC stdio file descriptor. Setting this option enables the subprocess.send() method. If the child is a Node.js process, the presence of an IPC channel will enable process.send() and process.disconnect() methods, as well as 'disconnect' and 'message' events within the child.
trans-unit.target: 'ipc' : crea un canal de IPC para pasar mensajes / descriptores de archivos entre padres e hijos. Un ChildProcess puede tener como máximo un descriptor de archivo stdio IPC. Establecer esta opción habilita el método subprocess.send() . Si el niño es un proceso Node.js, la presencia de un canal IPC habilitará los métodos process.send() y process.disconnect() , así como 'message' eventos 'disconnect' y 'mensaje' dentro del niño.

trans-unit.source: 'ipc': Create an IPC channel for passing messages/file descriptors between parent and child. A ChildProcess may have at most one IPC stdio file descriptor. Setting this option enables the subprocess.send() method. If the child is a Node.js process, the presence of an IPC channel will enable process.send() and process.disconnect() methods, as well as 'disconnect' and 'message' events within the child.

trans-unit.target: 'iso8859-14' , 'iso885914'

trans-unit.source: 'latin1' - A way of encoding the Buffer into a one-byte encoded string (as defined by the IANA in RFC 1345, page 63, to be the Latin-1 supplement block and C0/C1 control codes).
trans-unit.target: 'latin1' : una forma de codificar el Buffer en una cadena codificada de un byte (según lo definido por IANA en RFC 1345 , página 63, para ser el bloque de suplemento Latin-1 y los códigos de control C0 / C1).

trans-unit.source: 'latin1': Latin-1 stands for ISO-8859-1. This character encoding only supports the Unicode characters from U+0000 to U+00FF. Each character is encoded using a single byte. Characters that do not fit into that range are truncated and will be mapped to characters in that range.
'linked': module.link() has been called, and all its dependencies have been successfully linked.

trans-unit.source: 'linked': The module has been linked successfully, and all of its dependencies are linked, but module.evaluate() has not yet been called.
'linking': module.link() has been called, but not all Promises returned by the linker function have been resolved yet.
trans-unit.target: 'linking' module.link() ' : module.link () ha sido llamado, pero no todas las promesas devueltas por la función del vinculador se han resuelto todavía.

'node' (Node.js only)

'pipe' - Create a pipe between the child process and the parent process. The parent end of the pipe is exposed to the parent as a property on the child_process object as subprocess.stdio[fd]. Pipes created for fds 0 - 2 are also available as subprocess.stdin, subprocess.stdout and subprocess.stderr, respectively.
trans-unit.target: 'pipe' : crea una tubería entre el proceso hijo y el proceso padre. El extremo principal de la tubería se expone al padre como una propiedad en el objeto child_process como subprocess.stdio[fd] . Las canalizaciones creadas para fds 0 - 2 también están disponibles como subprocess.stdin , subprocess.stdout y subprocess.stderr , respectivamente.

trans-unit.source: 'pipe' - equivalent to ['pipe', 'pipe', 'pipe'] (the default)
trans-unit.target: 'pipe' - equivalente a ['pipe', 'pipe', 'pipe'] (el predeterminado)

trans-unit.source: 'pipe': Create a pipe between the child process and the parent process. The parent end of the pipe is exposed to the parent as a property on the child_process object as subprocess.stdio[fd]. Pipes created for fds 0, 1, and 2 are also available as subprocess.stdin, subprocess.stdout and subprocess.stderr, respectively.
'pipe': equivalent to ['pipe', 'pipe', 'pipe'] (the default)
'r' - Open file for reading. An exception occurs if the file does not exist.

trans-unit.source: 'r+': Open file for reading and writing. An exception occurs if the file does not exist.
'rs+' - Open file for reading and writing in synchronous mode. Instructs the operating system to bypass the local file system cache.
trans-unit.target: 'rs+' : archivo abierto para lectura y escritura en modo síncrono. Indica al sistema operativo que omita el caché del sistema de archivos local.

trans-unit.source: 'rs+': Open file for reading and writing in synchronous mode. Instructs the operating system to bypass the local file system cache.
'sign' - The key may be used to generate digital signatures.
'ucs2' - Alias of 'utf16le'.
trans-unit.target: 'ucs2' : alias de 'utf16le' .

trans-unit.source: 'ucs2': Alias of 'utf16le'. UCS-2 used to refer to a variant of UTF-16 that did not support characters that had code points larger than U+FFFF. In Node.js, these code points are always supported.
'udp4' or 'udp6' (UDP v4 or v6)
trans-unit.target: 'udp4' o 'udp6' (UDP v4 o v6)

trans-unit.source: 'uncaughtException' is a crude mechanism for exception handling intended to be used only as a last resort. The event should not be used as an equivalent to On Error Resume Next. Unhandled exceptions inherently mean that an application is in an undefined state. Attempting to resume application code without properly recovering from the exception can cause additional unforeseen and unpredictable issues.
trans-unit.target: 'uncaughtException' es un mecanismo burdo para el manejo de excepciones destinado a ser utilizado solo como último recurso. El evento no debe utilizarse como equivalente a On Error Resume Next . Las excepciones no controladas significan inherentemente que una aplicación está en un estado indefinido. Intentar reanudar el código de la aplicación sin recuperarse adecuadamente de la excepción puede causar problemas adicionales imprevistos e impredecibles.

trans-unit.source: 'unwrapKey' - The key may be used to unwrap another key.
'utf16le' - 2 or 4 bytes, little-endian encoded Unicode characters. Surrogate pairs (U+10000 to U+10FFFF) are supported.
trans-unit.target: 'utf16le' : 2 o 4 bytes, caracteres Unicode codificados en little-endian. Se admiten pares sustitutos (U + 10000 a U + 10FFFF).

trans-unit.source: 'utf16le': Multi-byte encoded Unicode characters. Unlike 'utf8', each character in the string will be encoded using either 2 or 4 bytes. Node.js only supports the little-endian variant of UTF-16.
'utf8' - Multibyte encoded Unicode characters. Many web pages and other document formats use UTF-8.
trans-unit.target: 'utf8' : caracteres Unicode codificados multibyte. Muchas páginas web y otros formatos de documentos utilizan UTF-8.

trans-unit.source: 'utf8': Multi-byte encoded Unicode characters. Many web pages and other document formats use UTF-8. This is the default character encoding. When decoding a Buffer into a string that does not exclusively contain valid UTF-8 data, the Unicode replacement character U+FFFD will be used to represent those errors.
'verify' - The key may be used to verify digital signatures.
'w' - Open file for writing. The file is created (if it does not exist) or truncated (if it exists).

trans-unit.source: 'w': Open file for writing. The file is created (if it does not exist) or truncated (if it exists).

trans-unit.source: 'w+': Open file for reading and writing. The file is created (if it does not exist) or truncated (if it exists).

--preserve-symlinks-main does not imply --preserve-symlinks; it is expected that --preserve-symlinks-main will be used in addition to --preserve-symlinks when it is not desirable to follow symlinks before resolving relative paths.

trans-unit.source: --report-filename Name of the file to which the report will be written.
trans-unit.target: --report-filename Nombre del archivo en el que se escribirá el informe.

trans-unit.source: --report-on-fatalerror Enables the report to be triggered on fatal errors (internal errors within the Node.js runtime, such as out of memory) that leads to termination of the application. Useful to inspect various diagnostic data elements such as heap, stack, event loop state, resource consumption etc. to reason about the fatal error.
trans-unit.target: --report-on-fatalerror Permite que el informe se active sobre errores fatales (errores internos dentro del tiempo de ejecución de Node.js, como memoria insuficiente) que provocan la terminación de la aplicación. Útil para inspeccionar varios elementos de datos de diagnóstico como montón, pila, estado de bucle de eventos, consumo de recursos, etc. para razonar sobre el error fatal.

trans-unit.source: --report-on-signal Enables report to be generated upon receiving the specified (or predefined) signal to the running Node.js process. (See below on how to modify the signal that triggers the report.) Default signal is SIGUSR2. Useful when a report needs to be triggered from another program. Application monitors may leverage this feature to collect report at regular intervals and plot rich set of internal runtime data to their views.
trans-unit.target: --report-on-signal Permite que el informe se genere al recibir la señal especificada (o predefinida) en el proceso Node.js en ejecución. (Vea a continuación cómo modificar la señal que activa el informe). La señal predeterminada es SIGUSR2 . Útil cuando un informe debe activarse desde otro programa. Los monitores de aplicaciones pueden aprovechar esta función para recopilar informes a intervalos regulares y trazar un amplio conjunto de datos internos en tiempo de ejecución en sus vistas.

trans-unit.source: --report-signal Sets or resets the signal for report generation (not supported on Windows). Default signal is SIGUSR2.
trans-unit.target: --report-signal Establece o restablece la señal para la generación de informes (no es compatible con Windows). La señal predeterminada es SIGUSR2 .

trans-unit.source: --report-uncaught-exception Enables report to be generated on un-caught exceptions. Useful when inspecting JavaScript stack in conjunction with native stack and other runtime environment data.
trans-unit.target: --report-uncaught-exception Permite generar informes sobre excepciones no detectadas. Útil al inspeccionar la pila de JavaScript junto con la pila nativa y otros datos del entorno de ejecución.

trans-unit.source: ALPNProtocols: <string[]> | <Buffer[]> | <TypedArray[]> | <DataView[]> | <Buffer> | <TypedArray> | <DataView> An array of strings, Buffers or TypedArrays or DataViews, or a single Buffer or TypedArray or DataView containing the supported ALPN protocols. Buffers should have the format [len][name][len][name]... e.g. '\x08http/1.1\x08http/1.0', where the len byte is the length of the next protocol name. Passing an array is usually much simpler, e.g. ['http/1.1', 'http/1.0']. Protocols earlier in the list have higher preference than those later.
trans-unit.target: ALPNProtocols : <cadena []> | <Búfer []> | <TypedArray []> | <DataView []> | <Buffer> | <TypedArray> | <DataView> Una matriz de cadenas, Buffer s o TypedArray s o DataView s, o un solo Buffer o TypedArray o DataView que contiene los protocolos ALPN compatibles. Buffer s deben tener el formato [len][name][len][name]... por ejemplo, '\x08http/1.1\x08http/1.0' , donde len byte es la longitud del siguiente nombre de protocolo. Pasar una matriz suele ser mucho más sencillo, por ejemplo, ['http/1.1', 'http/1.0'] . Los protocolos anteriores en la lista tienen mayor preferencia que los posteriores.

trans-unit.source: ALPNProtocols: <string[]> | <Buffer[]> | <TypedArray[]> | <DataView[]> | <Buffer> | <TypedArray> | <DataView> An array of strings, Buffers or TypedArrays or DataViews, or a single Buffer or TypedArray or DataView containing the supported ALPN protocols. Buffers should have the format [len][name][len][name]... e.g. 0x05hello0x05world, where the first byte is the length of the next protocol name. Passing an array is usually much simpler, e.g. ['hello', 'world']. (Protocols should be ordered by their priority.)
trans-unit.target: ALPNProtocols : <cadena []> | <Búfer []> | <TypedArray []> | <DataView []> | <Buffer> | <TypedArray> | <DataView> Una matriz de cadenas, Buffer s o TypedArray s o DataView s, o un solo Buffer o TypedArray o DataView que contiene los protocolos ALPN compatibles. Buffer s deben tener el formato [len][name][len][name]... p . Ej., 0x05hello0x05world , donde el primer byte es la longitud del siguiente nombre de protocolo. Pasar una matriz suele ser mucho más sencillo, por ejemplo, ['hello', 'world'] . (Los protocolos deben ordenarse por su prioridad).

trans-unit.source: ALPNProtocols: See tls.createServer()
trans-unit.target: ALPNProtocols : consulte tls.createServer()

Buffer instances are also Uint8Array instances. However, there are subtle incompatibilities with TypedArray. For example, while ArrayBuffer#slice() creates a copy of the slice, the implementation of Buffer#slice() creates a view over the existing Buffer without copying, making Buffer#slice() far more efficient.
trans-unit.target: Buffer instancias de búfer también son instancias de Uint8Array . Sin embargo, existen sutiles incompatibilidades con TypedArray . Por ejemplo, mientras ArrayBuffer#slice() crea una copia del segmento, la implementación de Buffer#slice() crea una vista sobre el Buffer existente sin copiar, lo que hace que Buffer#slice() mucho más eficiente.

trans-unit.source: Buffer instances are also JavaScript Uint8Array and TypedArray instances. All TypedArray methods are available on Buffers. There are, however, subtle incompatibilities between the Buffer API and the TypedArray API.

trans-unit.source: Buffer instances returned by Buffer.allocUnsafe()may be allocated off a shared internal memory pool if size is less than or equal to half Buffer.poolSize. Instances returned by Buffer.allocUnsafeSlow()never use the shared internal memory pool.
trans-unit.target: Buffer instancias de búfer devueltas por Buffer.allocUnsafe() pueden asignarse a un grupo de memoria interna compartida si el size es menor o igual a la mitad de Buffer.poolSize . Las instancias devueltas por Buffer.allocUnsafeSlow() nunca usan el grupo de memoria interna compartida.

trans-unit.source: Buffer instances returned by Buffer.allocUnsafe() and Buffer.from(array)may be allocated off a shared internal memory pool if size is less than or equal to half Buffer.poolSize. Instances returned by Buffer.allocUnsafeSlow()never use the shared internal memory pool.
Buffer objects are used to represent a fixed-length sequence of bytes. Many Node.js APIs support Buffers.

trans-unit.source: Content-Length is given in bytes not characters. The Buffer.byteLength() API may be used to determine the number of bytes in a given encoding. On outbound messages, Node.js does not check if Content-Length and the length of the body being transmitted are equal or not. However, when receiving messages, Node.js will automatically reject messages when the Content-Length does not match the actual payload size.
trans-unit.target: Content-Length se da en bytes, no en caracteres. La API Buffer.byteLength() se puede utilizar para determinar el número de bytes en una codificación determinada. En los mensajes salientes, Node.js no verifica si Content-Length y la longitud del cuerpo que se transmite son iguales o no. Sin embargo, al recibir mensajes, Node.js rechazará automáticamente los mensajes cuando la Content-Length del contenido no coincida con el tamaño real de la carga útil.

trans-unit.source: Content-Length is given in bytes not characters. The above example works because the string 'hello world' contains only single byte characters. If the body contains higher coded characters then Buffer.byteLength() should be used to determine the number of bytes in a given encoding. And Node.js does not check whether Content-Length and the length of the body which has been transmitted are equal or not.
trans-unit.target: Content-Length se da en bytes, no en caracteres. El ejemplo anterior funciona porque la cadena 'hello world' contiene solo caracteres de un solo byte. Si el cuerpo contiene caracteres codificados más altos, entonces se debe usar Buffer.byteLength() para determinar el número de bytes en una codificación dada. Y Node.js no comprueba si Content-Length y la longitud del cuerpo que se ha transmitido son iguales o no.

trans-unit.source: Content-Length is given in bytes, not characters. Use Buffer.byteLength() to determine the length of the body in bytes. Node.js does not check whether Content-Length and the length of the body which has been transmitted are equal or not.
Domain.dispose() has been removed. Recover from failed I/O actions explicitly via error event handlers set on the domain instead.
trans-unit.target: Domain.dispose() ha eliminado Domain.dispose () . Recuperarse de acciones de E / S fallidas explícitamente a través de controladores de eventos de error configurados en el dominio.

trans-unit.source: Domain is a child class of EventEmitter. To handle the errors that it catches, listen to its 'error' event.
trans-unit.target: Domain es una clase secundaria de EventEmitter . Para manejar los errores que detecta, escuche su evento 'error' .

trans-unit.source: EACCES (Permission denied): An attempt was made to access a file in a way forbidden by its file access permissions.
trans-unit.target: EACCES (Permiso denegado): se intentó acceder a un archivo de una manera prohibida por sus permisos de acceso a archivos.

trans-unit.source: EADDRINUSE (Address already in use): An attempt to bind a server (net, http, or https) to a local address failed due to another server on the local system already occupying that address.
trans-unit.target: EADDRINUSE (Dirección ya en uso): un intento de vincular un servidor ( net , http o https ) a una dirección local falló debido a que otro servidor en el sistema local ya ocupaba esa dirección.

trans-unit.source: ECONNREFUSED (Connection refused): No connection could be made because the target machine actively refused it. This usually results from trying to connect to a service that is inactive on the foreign host.
trans-unit.target: ECONNREFUSED (Conexión rechazada): No se pudo establecer ninguna conexión porque la máquina de destino la rechazó activamente. Esto suele ser el resultado de intentar conectarse a un servicio que está inactivo en el host externo.

trans-unit.source: ECONNRESET (Connection reset by peer): A connection was forcibly closed by a peer. This normally results from a loss of the connection on the remote socket due to a timeout or reboot. Commonly encountered via the http and net modules.
trans-unit.target: ECONNRESET (Conexión restablecida por un par): un par cerró a la fuerza una conexión. Esto normalmente se debe a una pérdida de la conexión en el conector remoto debido a un tiempo de espera o al reinicio. Se encuentra comúnmente a través de los módulos http y net .

trans-unit.source: EEXIST (File exists): An existing file was the target of an operation that required that the target not exist.
trans-unit.target: EEXIST (archivo existe): un archivo existente era el objetivo de una operación que requería que el objetivo no existiera.

trans-unit.source: EISDIR (Is a directory): An operation expected a file, but the given pathname was a directory.
trans-unit.target: EISDIR (es un directorio): una operación esperaba un archivo, pero el nombre de ruta dado era un directorio.

trans-unit.source: EMFILE (Too many open files in system): Maximum number of file descriptors allowable on the system has been reached, and requests for another descriptor cannot be fulfilled until at least one has been closed. This is encountered when opening many files at once in parallel, especially on systems (in particular, macOS) where there is a low file descriptor limit for processes. To remedy a low limit, run ulimit -n 2048 in the same shell that will run the Node.js process.
trans-unit.target: EMFILE (demasiados archivos abiertos en el sistema): se ha alcanzado el número máximo de descriptores de archivo permitidos en el sistema y las solicitudes de otro descriptor no se pueden cumplir hasta que se haya cerrado al menos uno. Esto se produce al abrir muchos archivos a la vez en paralelo, especialmente en sistemas (en particular, macOS) donde hay un límite de descriptor de archivo bajo para los procesos. Para remediar un límite bajo, ejecute ulimit -n 2048 en el mismo shell que ejecutará el proceso Node.js.

trans-unit.source: ENOENT (No such file or directory): Commonly raised by fs operations to indicate that a component of the specified pathname does not exist — no entity (file or directory) could be found by the given path.
trans-unit.target: ENOENT (No existe tal archivo o directorio): comúnmente generado por las operaciones fs para indicar que un componente del nombre de ruta especificado no existe - no se pudo encontrar ninguna entidad (archivo o directorio) por la ruta dada.

trans-unit.source: ENOENT (No such file or directory): Commonly raised by fs operations to indicate that a component of the specified pathname does not exist. No entity (file or directory) could be found by the given path.
ENOTDIR (Not a directory): A component of the given pathname existed, but was not a directory as expected. Commonly raised by fs.readdir.
trans-unit.target: ENOTDIR (No es un directorio): Existía un componente del nombre de ruta dado, pero no era un directorio como se esperaba. fs.readdir comúnmente por fs.readdir .

trans-unit.source: ENOTEMPTY (Directory not empty): A directory with entries was the target of an operation that requires an empty directory — usually fs.unlink.
trans-unit.target: ENOTEMPTY (directorio no vacío): un directorio con entradas era el objetivo de una operación que requiere un directorio vacío, generalmente fs.unlink .

trans-unit.source: ENOTEMPTY (Directory not empty): A directory with entries was the target of an operation that requires an empty directory, usually fs.unlink.
ENOTFOUND (DNS lookup failed): Indicates a DNS failure of either EAI_NODATA or EAI_NONAME. This is not a standard POSIX error.
trans-unit.target: ENOTFOUND (búsqueda de DNS fallida): indica una falla de DNS de EAI_NODATA o EAI_NONAME . Este no es un error POSIX estándar.

trans-unit.source: EPERM (Operation not permitted): An attempt was made to perform an operation that requires elevated privileges.
trans-unit.target: EPERM (Operación no permitida): se intentó realizar una operación que requiere privilegios elevados.

trans-unit.source: EPIPE (Broken pipe): A write on a pipe, socket, or FIFO for which there is no process to read the data. Commonly encountered at the net and http layers, indicative that the remote side of the stream being written to has been closed.
trans-unit.target: EPIPE (tubería rota): escritura en una tubería, conector o FIFO para la que no hay un proceso para leer los datos. Se encuentra comúnmente en las capas net y http , lo que indica que el lado remoto del flujo en el que se está escribiendo se ha cerrado.

trans-unit.source: ETIMEDOUT (Operation timed out): A connect or send request failed because the connected party did not properly respond after a period of time. Usually encountered by http or net — often a sign that a socket.end() was not properly called.
trans-unit.target: ETIMEDOUT (tiempo de espera de operación agotado): una solicitud de conexión o envío falló porque la parte conectada no respondió correctamente después de un período de tiempo. Generalmente lo encuentran http o net , a menudo una señal de que un socket.end() no se llamó correctamente.

trans-unit.source: ETIMEDOUT (Operation timed out): A connect or send request failed because the connected party did not properly respond after a period of time. Usually encountered by http or net. Often a sign that a socket.end() was not properly called.

NODE_PATH is not part of resolving import specifiers. Please use symlinks if this behavior is desired.
trans-unit.target: NODE_PATH no forma parte de la resolución de especificadores de import ación . Utilice enlaces simbólicos si desea este comportamiento.

trans-unit.source: NODE_PATH is still supported, but is less necessary now that the Node.js ecosystem has settled on a convention for locating dependent modules. Sometimes deployments that rely on NODE_PATH show surprising behavior when people are unaware that NODE_PATH must be set. Sometimes a module's dependencies change, causing a different version (or even a different module) to be loaded as the NODE_PATH is searched.
trans-unit.target: NODE_PATH todavía es compatible, pero es menos necesario ahora que el ecosistema Node.js se ha establecido en una convención para ubicar módulos dependientes. A veces, las implementaciones que se basan en NODE_PATH muestran un comportamiento sorprendente cuando las personas no saben que se debe configurar NODE_PATH . A veces, las dependencias de un módulo cambian, lo que hace que se cargue una versión diferente (o incluso un módulo diferente) NODE_PATH se busca en NODE_PATH .

trans-unit.source: NODE_PATH was originally created to support loading modules from varying paths before the current module resolution algorithm was defined.
trans-unit.target: NODE_PATH se creó originalmente para admitir la carga de módulos desde diferentes rutas antes de que se definiera el algoritmo de resolución de módulo actual .

trans-unit.source: NODE_REPL_HISTORY - When a valid path is given, persistent REPL history will be saved to the specified file rather than .node_repl_history in the user's home directory. Setting this value to '' (an empty string) will disable persistent REPL history. Whitespace will be trimmed from the value. On Windows platforms environment variables with empty values are invalid so set this variable to one or more spaces to disable persistent REPL history.
trans-unit.target: NODE_REPL_HISTORY : cuando se proporciona una ruta válida, el historial de REPL persistente se guardará en el archivo especificado en lugar de .node_repl_history en el directorio de inicio del usuario. Establecer este valor en '' (una cadena vacía) desactivará el historial de REPL persistente. Los espacios en blanco se recortarán del valor. En las plataformas Windows, las variables de entorno con valores vacíos no son válidas, así que configure esta variable en uno o más espacios para deshabilitar el historial de REPL persistente.

trans-unit.target: NODE_REPL_HISTORY_SIZE : controla cuántas líneas del historial se conservarán si el historial está disponible. Debe ser un número positivo. Predeterminado: 1000 .

trans-unit.source: NODE_REPL_HISTORY_SIZE: Controls how many lines of history will be persisted if history is available. Must be a positive number. Default:1000.
NODE_REPL_MODE - May be either 'sloppy' or 'strict'. Default:'sloppy', which will allow non-strict mode code to be run.

trans-unit.source: NODE_REPL_MODE: May be either 'sloppy' or 'strict'. Default:'sloppy', which will allow non-strict mode code to be run.

trans-unit.source: Promises and async functions can schedule tasks run by the JavaScript engine asynchronously. By default, these tasks are run after all JavaScript functions on the current stack are done executing. This allows escaping the functionality of the timeout and breakOnSigint options.

QuicSocket instances are not bound to a local UDP port until the first time either quicsocket.listen() or quicsocket.connect() is called. The 'ready' event will be emitted once the QuicSocket has been bound and the value of quicsocket.bound will become true.

trans-unit.source: SNICallback(servername, callback)<Function> A function that will be called if the client supports SNI TLS extension. Two arguments will be passed when called: servername and callback. callback is an error-first callback that takes two optional arguments: error and ctx. ctx, if provided, is a SecureContext instance. tls.createSecureContext() can be used to get a proper SecureContext. If callback is called with a falsy ctx argument, the default secure context of the server will be used. If SNICallback wasn't provided the default callback with high-level API will be used (see below).

SNICallback(servername, cb)<Function> A function that will be called if the client supports SNI TLS extension. Two arguments will be passed when called: servername and cb. SNICallback should invoke cb(null, ctx), where ctx is a SecureContext instance. (tls.createSecureContext(...) can be used to get a proper SecureContext.) If SNICallback wasn't provided the default callback with high-level API will be used (see below).
trans-unit.target: SNICallback(servername, cb) <Función> Una función a la que se llamará si el cliente admite la extensión SNI TLS. Se pasarán dos argumentos cuando se llamen: servername y cb . SNICallback debería invocar cb(null, ctx) , donde ctx es una instancia de SecureContext . ( tls.createSecureContext(...) se puede usar para obtener un SecureContext adecuado .) Si no se proporcionó SNICallback , se usará la devolución de llamada predeterminada con API de alto nivel (ver más abajo).

trans-unit.source: SNICallback: See tls.createServer()
trans-unit.target: SNICallback : consulte tls.createServer()

trans-unit.source: [in] call_js_cb: Optional callback which calls the JavaScript function in response to a call on a different thread. This callback will be called on the main thread. If not given, the JavaScript function will be called with no parameters and with undefined as its this value.

Esta devolución de llamada se llamará en el hilo principal. Si no se proporciona, la función de JavaScript se llamará sin parámetros y con undefined como this valor.

trans-unit.source: [in] call_js_cb: Optional callback which calls the JavaScript function in response to a call on a different thread. This callback will be called on the main thread. If not given, the JavaScript function will be called with no parameters and with undefined as its this value. napi_threadsafe_function_call_js provides more details.
[in] cb: The native function which should be called when this function object is invoked.

trans-unit.source: [in] complete: The native function which will be called when the asynchronous logic is completed or is cancelled. The given function is called from the main event loop thread. napi_async_complete_callback provides more details.

trans-unit.source: [in] constructor: Callback function that handles constructing instances of the class. This should be a static method on the class, not an actual C++ constructor function. napi_callback provides more details.

[in] constructor: Callback function that handles constructing instances of the class. When wrapping a C++ class, this method must be a static member with the napi_callback signature. A C++ class constructor cannot be used. napi_callback provides more details.

trans-unit.target: [in] context : contexto para la operación asincrónica que invoca la devolución de llamada. Este debería ser un valor obtenido previamente de napi_async_init .

trans-unit.target: [in] context : datos opcionales para adjuntar a la función napi_threadsafe_function resultante .

trans-unit.source: [in] context: The optional data with which the thread-safe function was created.
trans-unit.target: [in] context : los datos opcionales con los que se creó la función segura para subprocesos.

trans-unit.source: [in] data: Data created by the secondary thread. It is the responsibility of the callback to convert this native data to JavaScript values (with N-API functions) that can be passed as parameters when js_callback is invoked. This pointer is managed entirely by the threads and this callback. Thus this callback should free the data.
trans-unit.target: [in] data : datos creados por el hilo secundario. Es responsabilidad de la devolución de llamada convertir estos datos nativos en valores de JavaScript (con funciones de N-API) que se pueden pasar como parámetros cuando se invoca js_callback . Este puntero es administrado completamente por los hilos y esta devolución de llamada. Por lo tanto, esta devolución de llamada debería liberar los datos.

trans-unit.source: [in] data: Data to send into JavaScript via the callback call_js_cb provided during the creation of the thread-safe JavaScript function.
trans-unit.target: [in] data : datos para enviar a JavaScript a través de la devolución de llamada call_js_cb proporcionada durante la creación de la función JavaScript segura para subprocesos.

trans-unit.source: [in] data: Optional data to be passed to the constructor callback as the data property of the callback info.
trans-unit.target: [in] data : datos opcionales que se pasarán a la devolución de llamada del constructor como la propiedad de data de la información de devolución de llamada.

trans-unit.source: [in] data: Raw pointer to the external data.
trans-unit.target: [in] data : puntero sin procesar a los datos externos.

trans-unit.source: [in] mode: Flag whose value can be either napi_tsfn_release to indicate that the current thread will make no further calls to the thread-safe function, or napi_tsfn_abort to indicate that in addition to the current thread, no other thread should make any further calls to the thread-safe function. If set to napi_tsfn_abort, further calls to napi_call_threadsafe_function() will return napi_closing, and no further values will be placed in the queue.
trans-unit.target: [in] mode : napi_tsfn_release cuyo valor puede ser napi_tsfn_release para indicar que el hilo actual no realizará más llamadas a la función segura para el hilo, o napi_tsfn_abort para indicar que además del hilo actual, ningún otro hilo debe realizar más llamadas a la función segura para subprocesos. Si se establece en napi_tsfn_abort , más llamadas a napi_call_threadsafe_function() devolverán napi_closing y no se colocarán más valores en la cola.
